sep.gaia.state

Class Preferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.state.Preferences

  • public class Preferences
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for holding all settings of the application represented as key-value-pair. Also functionality for persistently storing and loading the stored data is provided.
    Author:
    Matthias Fisch

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Preferences getInstance()
        Returns the only instance of this class. If it does not exist when called, a new instance is created. When this is done all saved preferences will be loaded from disk.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.String def)
                           throws java.io.InvalidClassException
        Returns the value of the setting with key key. If the setting does not exits def is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the setting to query.
        Returns:
        The value of the setting.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidClassException - Thrown if the requested setting exists but is not of type String.

      • getInteger

        public java.lang.String getInteger(java.lang.String key,
                          int def)
                            throws java.io.InvalidClassException
        Returns the value of the setting with key key. If the setting does not exits def is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the setting to query.
        Returns:
        The value of the setting.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidClassException - Thrown if the requested setting exists but is not of type int.

      • getFloat

        public java.lang.String getFloat(java.lang.String key,
                        float def)
                          throws java.io.InvalidClassException
        Returns the value of the setting with key key. If the setting does not exits def is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - The name of the setting to query.
        Returns:
        The value of the setting.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidClassException - Thrown if the requested setting exists but is not of type float.

      • store

        public void store()
        Stores all currently set data to the file PREF_FILE. If the file does not exist it will be created. If an error occures no data will be written. For correct formating confer the XML-scheme in preferences.xsd.
